questions.question: How should you best read features from a database based on the result of joining two tables and meeting an attribute-based condition?
As the number of Features Per Bulk Write (chunk size) increases, the use of system resources increases and network traffic decreases.
Features Per Transaction must always be equal to or a multiple of Features Per Bulk Write.
Why do we suggest dropping indexes before writing to databases?
options: Writing with an existing index can lead to index-related errors.
The database will reject features with existing index values.
The index has to be provided to the database in a separate writing procedure.
The database automatically updates the index with every feature that is written.

questions.question: Why might Drop and Create be faster than Truncate Existing for Table Handling with database writers?
options: Creating database tables from nothing is always faster than appending to existing tables.
Truncate Existing is slower when working with spatial data.
Drop and Create deletes and recreates the index.
Truncate Existing deletes and recreates the index.
